titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Oversize Ms. Codex 1683: Alchemical compendium.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Extracts from works on chemistry and alchemy. Includes sections on distillation, calcination, fermentation, and discussion of the philosophers' stone. Also includes a list of contents (p. iii-viii).
msContents.textLang: German, with some words in Latin and marginal notes in English

author.name: Charles Rainsford Collection of Alchemical and Occult Manuscripts (University of Pennsylvania)

supportDesc.extent: 164 leaves : 300 x 205 (280 x 160) mm bound to 313 230 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, 164 leaves; [xvi], 1-15, 17-268, 268-320; contemporary pagination in ink, upper outer corners.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a semi-cursive script by a single hand.

binding.p: Contemporary parchment. Several leaves are detached.

origin.p: Written in Germany[?] in the second half of the 18th century.

history.provenance: Formerly owned by Charles Rainsford (British army officer, fellow of the Royal Society, and alchemist); bequeathed by Rainsford to Hugh Percy, Second Duke of Northumberland.
Owned by the 2nd through 12th Dukes of Northumberland, ms. 594, Alnwick Castle, Northumberland, 1809-2014 (bookplate, inside upper cover; stamps throughout).
Sold at auction at Sotheby's (London), 15 July 2014, as part of Lot 411.
